subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Can the Quickscript (QS) letter p be linked to the previous letter?
msgSnippet: Since the sound is pronounced double, the double letter is also appropriate under the rules in Read s handbook. In my opinion, the linked half Pea -- full Pea
messageBody:
Since the sound is pronounced double, the double letter is also appropriate under the rules in Read's handbook. In my opinion, the linked half Pea -- full Pea you propose is a good solution, given the example of the Senior Quickscript abbreviation for the word "people."

Though wouldn't you want a double half Pea in order to link with the next letter, 34 Ox, which starts at the midpoint, in order to spell "ippon"?


If I write something about judo and I use the Japanese words "ippon seoi nage", how should I write "ippon" in senior QS? Should I use two separate Pea's, or should I use a half Pea linked to a following full Pea?

The "p" is geminated and I pronounce the two "p"'s separately, the 1st one at the end of the 1st syllable and the 2nd one at the beginning of the following syllable.          



--

Jonathan Korman  ::  dilettante   consultant   bon vivant  ::  miniver.blogspot.com

I'm transitioning to GMail, so please start using this address for me!
